concept.title: Changing the firmware level
concept.shortdesc: System administrators can upgrade or roll back the firmware level of the appliance.

conbody.p: You can use the firmware upgrade command on the command line to upgrade from an older firmware level to a newer firmware level. All of the appliance configuration data and the persistent messages that are stored on the appliance are preserved when you upgrade. firmware levels take on the following format: V.R.M.F. (version, release, modification, fix pack). You cannot skip firmware levels at the version or release level when you upgrade. When the firmware upgrade is a version or release level upgrade, the upgrade cannot be rolled back.

If the firmware upgrade was a fix pack level upgrade, you can use the firmware rollback command to revert to the firmware level that was installed before the upgrade. The system configuration and the persistent messages that are stored on the appliance are preserved when you roll back a fix pack upgrade.
